title: Ronald Caress
text:
Ronald Caress (third ¼ 1920 – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s. He played at club level for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage No. 473</a>) and <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage No. 252</a>) (<a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">guest</a>), as a or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
Background.
Ronald Caress' birth was registered in <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
Club career.
Ronald Caress made his début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> during October 1940, he played his last match for Wakefield Trinity during November 1944, he transferred as a <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">guest</a> from Wakefield Trinity to <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a>, he made his début for Castleford on Saturday 11 November 1944, and he played his last match for Castleford on Saturday 11 November 1944.
